question: What was Arikamedu during ancient India?
option1: A coastal settlement and trade centre
option3: A city in Aravalli Mountains in Gujarat
answer: A coastal settlement and trade centre
explanation: Arikamedu, the ancient Roman trade centre is 4 Kms. South of Puducherry on the right bank of Ariyankuppam river. Arikamedu was an Indo- Roman coastal trading station and an important centre of trade and commerce with the Western world during the early centuries of the Christian era. This port was known to the author of “Periplus of the Erithrian Sea” as Padouke.%%
